name: La Torre
excerpt: This viewpoint overlooking a photogenic stretch of coastline (direction: Manarola) is reached by a stairway that leads up from the diminutive main square,…
detail_description: This viewpoint overlooking a photogenic stretch of coastline (direction: Manarola) is reached by a stairway that leads up from the diminutive main square, Piazza Taragio. The tiny square is also a favourite spot among Corniglia's youngest residents to kick around a football.

name: Guvano Beach
excerpt: This lovely, hard-to-reach beach was once a famous nudist spot from the 1960s to the 1990s, when it was accessed by walking through an abandoned railway…
detail_description: This lovely, hard-to-reach beach was once a famous nudist spot from the 1960s to the 1990s, when it was accessed by walking through an abandoned railway tunnel. Unfortunately, landslides have led to the tunnel's closure, and the only way to reach Guvano today involves hiring a kayak or arranging a visit on a private boat tour.

name: Belvedere di Santa Maria
excerpt: Enjoy dazzling 180-degree sea views at this heart-stopping lookout in hilltop Corniglia. To find it, follow Via Fieschi through the village until you…
detail_description: Enjoy dazzling 180-degree sea views at this heart-stopping lookout in hilltop Corniglia. To find it, follow Via Fieschi through the village until you eventually reach the clifftop balcony.

name: Chiesa San Pietro
excerpt: Near the entrance to the village, the small Gothic church dedicated to St Peter has stood here since at least the 14th century (and was likely built on…
detail_description:
Near the entrance to the village, the small Gothic church dedicated to St Peter has stood here since at least the 14th century (and was likely built on the site of a smaller 11th-century chapel). The grey stone facade is lightened by a lacy Carrara-marble rose window and a small statue of a key-wielding St Peter flanked by two figures above the entrance.
The interior is awash with baroque finery, including a finely crafted altarpiece and 18th-century paintings.
